channel.title: [PI] Teleporting Help [PI]
channel.description:
Ok i know this is a stupid question and i expect this is very bad karma, but still im going to ask
When i do a teleport i put this in
[code]String type = c.playerMagicBook == 0 ? "modern" : "ancient"; c.getPA().startTeleport(3366, 3265, 0, type);[/code]
When i put this down and i compile it i get this as a error
[code]src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:976: type is already defin ed in processPacket(server.model.players.Client,int,int) String type = c.playerMagicBook == 0 ? "modern" : "ancie nt"; ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
When i take the String type... off i get this error
[code]src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:977: variable type might n ot have been initialized c.getPA().startTeleport(3366, 3265, 0, type); ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Im not sure what it is but still lol, any help i will Rep++

item.title: [PI] Teleporting Help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @ZioBotic ZioBotic
item.description:
@ZioBotic wrote:

[quote=“john5689, post:6, topic:412804”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=514280.msg3733141#msg3733141 date=1314737664]

just make a new method…

public void movePlaye2(int x, int y, int h, String type) { c.resetWalkingQueue(); c.teleportToX = x; c.teleportToY = y; c.heightLevel = h; requestUpdates(); }

Im not on Delta…

How is that Delta??
Just use that method under movePlayer( and just always declare that String.
[/quote]

Ok it just looked like delta lol :P.

just make a new method…

public void movePlaye2(int x, int y, int h, String type) { c.resetWalkingQueue(); c.teleportToX = x; c.teleportToY = y; c.heightLevel = h; requestUpdates(); }

Im not on Delta…

How is that Delta??
Just use that method under movePlayer( and just always declare that String.

I did what you told me and i got this

[code]src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:976: illegal start of expr
ession
public void movePlaye2(int x, int y, int h, String type)
{
^
src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:976: illegal start of expr
ession
public void movePlaye2(int x, int y, int h, String type)
{
^
src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:976: ‘;’ expected
public void movePlaye2(int x, int y, int h, String type)
{
^
src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:976: expected

                    public void movePlaye2(int x, int y, int h, String type)

{
^
src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:976: not a statement
public void movePlaye2(int x, int y, int h, String type)
{
^
src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:976: ‘;’ expected
public void movePlaye2(int x, int y, int h, String type)
{
^
src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:976: ‘;’ expected
public void movePlaye2(int x, int y, int h, String type)
{
^
src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:976: not a statement
public void movePlaye2(int x, int y, int h, String type)
{
^
src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:976: ‘;’ expected
public void movePlaye2(int x, int y, int h, String type)
{
^

9 errors
Press any key to continue . . .[/code][/quote]
Delta would be like Triggertele(2132, 2324, 0, );

Read full topic

just make a new method…

Im not on Delta…

Just use that method under movePlayer( and just always declare that String.[/quote]

just make a new method…

public void movePlaye2(int x, int y, int h, String type) { c.resetWalkingQueue(); c.teleportToX = x; c.teleportToY = y; c.heightLevel = h; requestUpdates(); }
[/quote]

Im not on Delta…[/quote]
How is that Delta??
Just use that method under movePlayer( and just always declare that String.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Teleporting Help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @john5689 john5689
item.description:
@john5689 wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:3, topic:412804”]just make a new method…

public void movePlaye2(int x, int y, int h, String type) { c.resetWalkingQueue(); c.teleportToX = x; c.teleportToY = y; c.heightLevel = h; requestUpdates(); }[/quote]

Im not on Delta…

[quote=“Resent, post:2, topic:412804”][quote author=john5689 link=topic=514280.msg3733094#msg3733094 date=1314735967]
Ok i know this is a stupid question and i expect this is very bad karma, but still im going to ask

When i do a teleport i put this in

String type = c.playerMagicBook == 0 ? "modern" : "ancient"; c.getPA().startTeleport(3366, 3265, 0, type);

When i put this down and i compile it i get this as a error

src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:976: type is already defin ed in processPacket(server.model.players.Client,int,int) String type = c.playerMagicBook == 0 ? "modern" : "ancie nt"; ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

When i take the String type… off i get this error

src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:977: variable type might n ot have been initialized c.getPA().startTeleport(3366, 3265, 0, type); ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Im not sure what it is but still lol, any help i will Rep++
[/quote]

I tried the same thing and got the same error, it’s because you trying to cross enter a teleport command from a different source.

How to fix it: The spellbook part isn’t necessary. All you need is c.getPA().startTeleport(3366, 3265, 0, type); so remove the String type = c.playerMagicBook == 0 ? "modern" : "ancient"; part and leave the rest. That should solve your issue.

Note: Make sure that you’re not putting a space between the coords and the teleport command or else you’ll keep on getting the same error even when removing the public static string code.

Example:

Wrong: [code]Code1

       Code2[/code]

Right: Code1 Code2

In simple means, ensure you’re inserting the code directly under your first one.[/quote]

huh i don’t get that… What i think your trying to tell me is to delete the String type = c.playerMagicBook == 0 ? “modern” : “ancient”;, and when i do i get that

src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:977: variable type might n ot have been initialized c.getPA().startTeleport(3366, 3265, 0, type); ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Teleporting Help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Resent Resent
item.description:
@Resent wrote:

[quote=“john5689, post:1, topic:412804”]Ok i know this is a stupid question and i expect this is very bad karma, but still im going to ask

When i do a teleport i put this in

String type = c.playerMagicBook == 0 ? "modern" : "ancient"; c.getPA().startTeleport(3366, 3265, 0, type);

When i put this down and i compile it i get this as a error

src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:976: type is already defin ed in processPacket(server.model.players.Client,int,int) String type = c.playerMagicBook == 0 ? "modern" : "ancie nt"; ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

When i take the String type… off i get this error

src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:977: variable type might n ot have been initialized c.getPA().startTeleport(3366, 3265, 0, type); ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Im not sure what it is but still lol, any help i will Rep++[/quote]

I tried the same thing and got the same error, it’s because you trying to cross enter a teleport command from a different source.

How to fix it: The spellbook part isn’t necessary. All you need is c.getPA().startTeleport(3366, 3265, 0, type); so remove the String type = c.playerMagicBook == 0 ? "modern" : "ancient"; part and leave the rest. That should solve your issue.

Note: Make sure that you’re not putting a space between the coords and the teleport command or else you’ll keep on getting the same error even when removing the public static string code.

Example:

Wrong: [code]Code1

       Code2[/code]

Right: Code1 Code2

In simple means, ensure you’re inserting the code directly under your first one.

Read full topic
